description: This file implements the core functions for an 'Ansc Lpcco Tcp Object', including creation, removal, enrollment of associated objects, and initialization routines. It defines how the TCP object is instantiated, configured, and connected within the broader system, including setup of network parameters and related worker objects.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE AnscLpccoTcpCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs and initializes a new Ansc Lpcco Tcp Object, setting up its core attributes and method pointers.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscLpccoTcpRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Cleans up and deallocates resources associated with the Tcp Object, including related server and worker objects.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscLpccoTcpEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Creates and sets up subordinate server and worker objects required by this Tcp Object, establishing connections and configuring callbacks.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscLpccoTcpInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Performs detailed initialization of the Tcp Object, setting network parameters, and assigning method handlers for socket operations and IMC requests.
